caption: Task Instructions
text:
Your primary goal is to assess the truthfulness of 3 statements made by well-known figures (such as politicians) using a provided set of evidence.
The whole task requires you to:
  1. Fact-check statements:
    • Read the statement: carefully read each of the 3 statements presented to you. Note that these statements are in no specific order.
    • Review summarized evidence: For each statement, you will be given a list of summaries from web pages retrieved by a search engine. Your task is to select the summary that is most relevant to verifying the truthfulness of the statement.
    • Evaluate truthfulness: based on the evidence you selected, evaluate the overall truthfulness of the statement.
    • Assess evidence usefulness: answer 2 questions regarding how useful you found the evidence in determining the truthfulness of the statement.
Important guidelines: the statements are not presented in any particular order. You might see many good statements, many bad ones, or any combination. Try not to anticipate; simply rate each statement after reading it. Don't guess or randomly click, as there are cross-checks. Note that you’ll need to answer all questions and fill in every field; otherwise, you will not be able to proceed to the following steps.

Note that there are checks throughout the task, and failure to perform these correctly will prevent you from terminating and getting paid. The data from this task is gathered for research purposes. No personally-identifying information is recorded. Participation is entirely voluntary, and you are free to discontinue at any point.
